DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the serological titer.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A laboratory test that has blood as its specimen._Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens._Concentration of a substance in a solution as determined by the quantitative reaction with added measured volume(s) of a solution of the precisely known concentration(s) of a standard reagent.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A laboratory test that has blood as its specimen.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory test to measure hematopoietic components and investigate hematologic disorders in a blood sample.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.:Concentration of a substance in a solution as determined by the quantitative reaction with added measured volume(s) of a solution of the precisely known concentration(s) of a standard reagent.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.
Concentration of a substance in a solution as determined by the quantitative reaction with added measured volume(s) of a solution of the precisely known concentration(s) of a standard reagent.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens._Concentration of a substance in a solution as determined by the quantitative reaction with added measured volume(s) of a solution of the precisely known concentration(s) of a standard reagent._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The determination of the amount of Epstein-Barr capsid IgM antibody present in a sample.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the amount of Epstein-Barr capsid IgM antibody present in a sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The determination of the amount of Epstein-Barr capsid IgG antibody present in a sample.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the amount of Epstein-Barr capsid IgG antibody present in a sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The determination of the amount of Epstein-Barr early antigen present in a sample.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the amount of Epstein-Barr early antigen present in a sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The determination of the amount of Epstein-Barr nuclear antigen present in a sample.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the amount of Epstein-Barr nuclear antigen present in a sample.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.:Concentration of a substance in a solution as determined by the quantitative reaction with added measured volume(s) of a solution of the precisely known concentration(s) of a standard reagent.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.
Concentration of a substance in a solution as determined by the quantitative reaction with added measured volume(s) of a solution of the precisely known concentration(s) of a standard reagent.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
